title: Manage Office 365 subscription with SAM
content:
With the support of Microsoft 365 integration, the support for integrating SAM with legacy Office 365 is deprecated. 

If you're using the legacy Office 365 and want to manage its subscription information with SAM, follow these steps:

  1. Log in to Suite Administration, click CONFIGURATIONS, click the Proxy Settings tab, and then complete the settings. For more information, see Proxy Settings tab.    
  2. Sign in to Service Management, choose Run > Software Asset Management > Products, click the SaaS tab, and then select Office 365. Note that you might need to unselect the Managed Products filter.
  3. Click Configuration.
  4. In the dialog box that appears, update the fields in the following table:
    Field Description
    Server URL

    Enter the production Azure AD authentication endpoint, where authorizing the SAM application starts.

    In the Endpoints list, you might find multiple endpoints. Use the OAuth 2.0 Token endpoint (v2) option as the server URL.
    Server Resource URL Default: https://graph.microsoft.com/beta/

    Keep the default value unchanged.
    Server Client ID

    Enter the Application ID that the Azure app registration portal assigned when you registered your Service Management application.

    Make sure that you go to Azure Active Directory > App registrations > API permissions and assign the Reports.Read.All and Directory.Read.All permissions to Service Management. In addition, Application permissions and Admin consent are required.
    Server Client Secret Enter the Application Secret that you generated for your Service Management application in the app registration portal.
    Server Scope

    The value passed for the scope parameter in this request should be the resource identifier (Application ID URI) of the resource you want, affixed with the .default suffix.

    For Microsoft Graph, the value is https://graph.microsoft.com/.default. This value informs the Microsoft identity platform endpoint that of all the application permissions you have configured for your Service Management application, it should issue a token for the ones associated with the resource you want to use.

    Keep the default value unchanged.
    Server Grant Type Default: client_credentials

    Keep the default value unchanged.
  5. Click SAVE.
